src.ui package¶

Submodules¶

src.ui.dashboard module¶

Just run using python dashboard.py

src.ui.dashboard.add_frame(text)[source]¶

Add frame to raw text.

Parameters

text – raw report text

Returns

report text with frame

src.ui.dashboard.assign_slider_text_update_callback(field: str) → None[source]¶

Register a callback on the text above categorical sliders. It will then update that text according to the current selection.

Parameters

field – the categorical data field

src.ui.dashboard.convert_category_number_to_str(d: dict)[source]¶

Given a dictionary of the form {field: value} convert values to their string representations if the field is categorical

Parameters

d – {field: value}

Returns

dictionary of the same form as the input

src.ui.dashboard.fig_formatter(**kw)[source]¶

Decorator for functions that produce figures. By default, all margins are stripped, but the margin sized can be set indivdually.

Parameters

  • t – top margin

  • l – left margin

  • r – right margin

  • b – bottom margin

Returns

src.ui.dashboard.generate_model_input(x_range: numpy.ndarray, exog: List[str], x_values: Tuple[float], x_var: str, n_points: int) → Dict[str, Union[numpy.ndarray, List]][source]¶

Produce a dictionary to be passed to the model for prediction

Parameters

  • x_range – The values of x_var

  • exog – The field to predict

  • x_values – The slider values

  • x_var – The continuous exogenous variable

  • n_points – The number of points of the exogenous variable to use

Returns

{field: [v1, …, vn]}

src.ui.dashboard.get_slider(field: str) → dash_html_components.Div.Div[source]¶

Return a hidden div with slider text above the slider.

Parameters

field – A field from the list of valid fields

:return hidden div

src.ui.dashboard.get_sunburst_plot(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
src.ui.dashboard.make_correlation_heatmap(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
src.ui.dashboard.make_hist_plot(fields, bar_width)[source]¶

Histogram plot callback

Parameters

  • fields – content of dropdown menu

  • bar_width – value of slider

Returns

plotly figure

src.ui.dashboard.make_importance_bar_plot(x: List[str], y: str)[source]¶

Create the importance bar plot

Parameters

  • x – x variables list

  • y – y variable, normally self-efficiency

Returns

plotly figure

src.ui.dashboard.make_prediction_plot(exog: List, endog: str, x_var: str, *slider_values: float)[source]¶

Callback to generate the prediction plot

Parameters

  • exog – exogenous (independent) variable names as a list

  • endog – endogenous (dependent) variable name

  • x_var – another exogenous variable to be used as the plot’s x-axis

  • slider_values – tuple of the values of the sliders, including the hidden ones

Returns

plotly figure

src.ui.dashboard.make_report(exog: List, endog: str, x_var: str, *slider_values: float)[source]¶

Generate report text.

Parameters

  • exog – List of fields

  • endog – y variable

  • x_var – variable of x-axis

  • slider_values – values of all sliders in exog fields

Returns

report text

src.ui.dashboard.make_second_explore_plot(categorical: list, continuous, plot)[source]¶

Make a plot based on the categorical and continuous data selected. Choose a box plot or frequency plot depending on the plot selected.

Parameters

  • categorical – list of data categories

  • continuous – single continuous data field

  • plot – “frequency plot” or “box plot”

Returns

plotly figure

src.ui.dashboard.make_sunburst(fields, color_var)[source]¶

Callback to generate the sunburst figure based on the selected categorical input fields and the desired continuous variable, used to color the segments.

Parameters

  • color_var – The continuous variable with which to color the segments

  • fields – Categorical data fields with which to size segments by frequency

Returns

plotly figure

src.ui.dashboard.populate_dropdown(category: str = None) → List[dict][source]¶

Generate a list of dictionaries to use to populate the dropdown menus

Parameters

category – ‘continuous’ or ‘categorical’. If None select all variables.

Returns

a list of dicts with keys ‘label’ and ‘value’

src.ui.dashboard.show_ml_sliders(fields: List, state: List)[source]¶

Show the sliders that were selected using the multiple dropdown. Hide the others.

Parameters

  • fields – List of fields

  • state – children of the ml_sliders <P>

Returns

updated state

src.ui.dashboard.toggle_modal(n1, n2, is_open)[source]¶

Modal style report window :param n1: click or not for open button :param n2: click or not for close button :param is_open: boolean :return: boolean is_open

src.ui.dashboard.train_model(endog: str, exog: List[str], x_var: str)[source]¶

Train predictive model based on the chosen variables

Parameters

  • endog – endogenous (dependent) variable name

  • exog – exogenous (independent) variable names as a list

  • x_var – another exogenous variable that will be used as the x-axis in the plot

Returns

src.ui.dashboard.update_text(data)[source]¶

Update 4 small windows above histogram :param data: column data in selected field :return: 4 stastistical number, max, min, mean, median number
